firstNightReminder: The Alphabetizer points to two players. Point to the one whose name comes first in the alphabet.
otherNightReminder: The Alphabetizer points to two players. Point to the one whose name comes first in the alphabet.
name: Alphabetizer
ability: Each night choose 2 players, you learn which comes first alphabetically.

firstNightReminder: The Detoxer points to a player, they are no longer poisoned or drunk. Remove the Drunk token from the Drunk.
otherNightReminder: The Detoxer points to a player, they are no longer poisoned or drunk. Remove the Drunk token from the Drunk.
name: Detoxer
ability: Each night, choose a player: they are no longer drunk or poisoned.

otherNightReminder: If the Night Guard has not yet used their ability: ask if they want to use it. If they nod 'yes', set a reminder token that their vote doesn't count tomorrow.
name: Night Guard
ability: Once per game at night*, your two alive townsfolk neighbors cannot die tonight nor be affected by minion abilities. Your vote doesn't count tomorrow.

otherNightReminder: The Recruit points to an alive player: if they are an outsider then mark them with a Militia token. Before the next day, inform them who the Recruit is and that they are Militia.
name: Recruit
ability: Each night*, choose an alive player: if they are an outsider, they become a Militia. The Militia learns who the recruit is that night. [+1 Outsider]

name: Red Riding Hood
ability: Minion abilities do not work on you.

firstNightReminder: If the Sapper has not yet used their ability: the sapper either shakes their head 'no' or they point to a player and guess their role. If correct, that player is now poisoned.
otherNightReminder: If the Sapper has not yet used their ability: the sapper either shakes their head 'no' or they point to a player and guess their role. If correct, that player is now poisoned.
name: Sapper
ability: Once per game, at night choose an alive player: guess their role, if correct you gain their ability and they become poisoned. The Sapper starts knowing one not in-play townsfolk.
